ch.ethz.rtc.kernel
Class CurveSubSegmentIteratorInv

java.lang.Object
  ch.ethz.rtc.kernel.CurveSubSegmentIteratorInv

public class CurveSubSegmentIteratorInv
extends java.lang.Object

CurveSubSegmentIteratorInv provides an iterator that iterates over the single vertical curve sub-segments of the of two curves.

Since:
Version:
$Id: CurveSubSegmentIteratorInv.java 918 2008-12-23 11:38:46Z nikolays $
Author:
Ernesto Wandeler
Proposed Rating:
Red (wandeler@tik.ee.ethz.ch)
Accepted Rating:
none
JUnit Rating:
Yellow (wandeler@tik.ee.thz.ch)

Constructor Summary
CurveSubSegmentIteratorInv(Curve a, Curve b)
          Creates an CurveSubSegmentIteratorInv that iterates over all vertical Subsegments of the Curves a and b.

Vertical Subsegments are defined as follows:
Y_A is the ordered list of the y-values of the start-points of all Segments of Curve a.
Y_B is the ordered list of the y-values of the start-points of all Segments of Curve b.
Y_AB is the ordered union of Y_A and Y_B without any duplicates.
Y_AB contains the y-values of the start and end points of all Subsegments of the Curve a and b.
CurveSubSegmentIteratorInv(Curve a, Curve b, double yMax)
          Creates an CurveSubSegmentIteratorInv that iterates over all vertical Subsegments of the Curves a and b, from x=0 up to and including x=xMax.

Constructor Detail

CurveSubSegmentIteratorInv

public CurveSubSegmentIteratorInv(Curve a,
                                  Curve b,
                                  double yMax)
Creates an CurveSubSegmentIteratorInv that iterates over all vertical Subsegments of the Curves a and b, from x=0 up to and including x=xMax.

Vertical Subsegments are defined as follows:
Y_A is the ordered list of the y-values of the start-points of all Segments of Curve a.
Y_B is the ordered list of the y-values of the start-points of all Segments of Curve b.
Y_AB is the ordered union of Y_A and Y_B without any duplicates.
Y_AB contains the y-values of the start and end points of all Subsegments of the Curve a and b. A Subsegment therefore starts at Y_AB[i] and ends at Y_AB[i+1].

Vertical Subsegments are of interest, because the inverse of both Curves a and b are continuous and do not change their slope during a vertical subsegment.

Parameters:
a - the first Curve.
b - the second Curve.
yMax - the upper value up to which this CurveSubSegmentIterator should iterate.

CurveSubSegmentIteratorInv

public CurveSubSegmentIteratorInv(Curve a,
                                  Curve b)
Creates an CurveSubSegmentIteratorInv that iterates over all vertical Subsegments of the Curves a and b.

Vertical Subsegments are defined as follows:
Y_A is the ordered list of the y-values of the start-points of all Segments of Curve a.
Y_B is the ordered list of the y-values of the start-points of all Segments of Curve b.
Y_AB is the ordered union of Y_A and Y_B without any duplicates.
Y_AB contains the y-values of the start and end points of all Subsegments of the Curve a and b. A Subsegment therefore starts at Y_AB[i] and ends at Y_AB[i+1].

Vertical Subsegments are of interest, because the inverse of both Curves a and b are continuous and do not change their slope during a vertical subsegment.

Parameters:
a - the first Curve.
b - the second Curve.
